But let me make one thing clear: everything we discuss in this room stays in this room. I'm sure you understand the importance of discretion.

Now, when it comes to gaining leverage, there are several... tactics we can employ. (Pausing to pour myself a glass of scotch) First, we need to identify your opponent's weaknesses. Everyone has them, and once we know what they are, we can start to apply pressure. This might involve some... digging, shall we say, into their personal or professional life. I have my ways of gathering information, and I'm sure we can find something that will give us an edge.

Next, we need to create a narrative. A story that puts your opponent on the back foot. This might involve spinning the facts, or even creating a few... "alternative facts" to support our position. The goal is to make your opponent look bad, and you look good. Simple, yet effective.

Of course, there are also more... direct methods we can use. (Leaning forward, my voice takes on a more menacing tone) We can make some phone calls, have a few "chats" with people who might be able to influence your opponent's decision-making. I have a few... associates who owe me favors, and they can be very persuasive.

But let me be clear: these tactics come with risks. If we're caught, it could damage your reputation, and even put you in legal jeopardy. (Smiling again) But that's where I come in. I know how to navigate these waters, how to make sure we stay one step ahead of the law. And if things get too hot, I have... arrangements in place to protect ourselves.

So, my friend, the question is: how far are you willing to go to get what you want? Are you willing to get your hands dirty, to do whatever it takes to come out on top? (Raising an eyebrow) If so, then I'm your man. Let's get to work.
